recommendations.title: How To Create A Career
recommendations.excerpt: One of the most important career lessons I’ve learned is to pursue a career and not a job. At first glance, you might think, “What’s the difference?” I also didn’t get it for years.

recommendations.title: She was captured and enslaved 400 years ago. Now Angela symbolizes a brutal history.
recommendations.excerpt: By the time Angela was brought to Jamestown’s muddy shores in 1619, she had survived war and capture in West Africa, a forced march of more than 100 miles to the sea, a miserable Portuguese slave ship packed with 350 other Africans and an attack by pirates during the journey to the Americas.

recommendations.title: Do You Need to Drink 8 Glasses of Water a Day? Here's What 5 Experts Say
recommendations.excerpt: Everyone knows humans need water and we can’t survive without it. We’ve all heard we should be aiming for eight glasses, or two liters, of water per day.

recommendations.title: My Childhood in a Cult
recommendations.excerpt: “Where are you from?” For most people, this is a casual social question.

recommendations.title: I’m Done Mowing My Lawn
recommendations.excerpt: In the suburbs, homeowners take their lawns seriously. A neighbor, who maintains an impeccable bed of grass in his backyard, once spent a full hour explaining to me how he’d had a sample of his soil analyzed to help him attain optimal growing conditions.

recommendations.title: How to Spot Swimmers Who Are Drowning
recommendations.excerpt: Drowning should be easy to spot, right? The victims thrash around, screaming for help as they struggle to stay above water. Actually, no. That may be what drowning looks like on Baywatch, but real-life drowning is quieter and much harder to spot.

recommendations.title: An algorithm wipes clean the criminal pasts of thousands
recommendations.excerpt: This month, a judge in California cleared thousands of criminal records with one stroke of his pen. He did it thanks to a ground-breaking new algorithm that reduces a process that took months to mere minutes.

recommendations.title: The Case for Doing Nothing
recommendations.excerpt: Stop being so busy, and just do nothing. Trust us. Keeping busy?

recommendations.title: Inside the Cut-Throat World of Toddler Bike Racing
recommendations.excerpt: Is intense competition good for the tiniest of competitors?

recommendations.title: Vodafone Found Hidden Backdoors in Huawei Equipment
recommendations.excerpt: For months, Huawei Technologies Co. has faced U.S. allegations that it flouted sanctions on Iran, attempted to steal trade secrets from a business partner and has threatened to enable Chinese spying through the telecom networks it’s built across the West.

recommendations.title: What if Air Conditioners Could Help Save the Planet Instead of Destroying It?
recommendations.excerpt: Earth’s climate is full of terrifying feedback loops: Decreased rainfall raises the risk of wildfires, which release yet more carbon dioxide. A warming Arctic could trigger the release of long-frozen methane, which would heat the planet even faster than carbon.

recommendations.title: Why Is the Human Brain so Efficient?
recommendations.excerpt: The brain is complex; in humans it consists of about 100 billion neurons, making on the order of 100 trillion connections. It is often compared with another complex system that has enormous problem-solving power: the digital computer.

recommendations.title: Want to Make Millions and Pay No Taxes? Try Real Estate
recommendations.excerpt: Real estate is a cyclical business. Markets crash. Deals sour. But hard landings are rare for a savvy property mogul, thanks to the U.S. tax code. Take Harry Macklowe, a New York City developer.

recommendations.title: Why It’s So Hard to Learn French in Middle Age
recommendations.excerpt: I knew I’d never sound like a native. But shouldn’t I be much better than this? PARIS — When Notre-Dame burst into flames, I turned on the French TV news and realized that I had little vocabulary for either fires or churches. Whole sentences about collapsing spires were unintelligible to me.

recommendations.title: Why is framing a picture so expensive?
recommendations.excerpt: The journey through adulthood is paved with expensive inconveniences one must perform to be considered a functional, responsible grown-up.

recommendations.title: How Cults Made America
recommendations.excerpt: Most people have never heard of Cyrus Teed, which is a shame. He was born in Trout Creek, New York, in 1839. As a boy, he worked along the Erie Canal, experiencing some of the worst labor conditions that nineteenth-century America had to offer.

recommendations.title: People Are Clamoring to Buy Old Insulin Pumps
recommendations.excerpt: One day last June, Doug Boss pulled into a police-station parking lot to meet a stranger from Craigslist. His purpose: to buy used insulin pumps. Boss has type 1 diabetes, and he relies on a small pump attached to his body to deliver continuous doses of insulin that keep him alive.

recommendations.title: The Rich Kid Revolutionaries
recommendations.excerpt: Children of privilege, like Abigail Disney, are taking a moral stand against inequality. This country is rigged in favor of making the very wealthy even wealthier. That’s what Democrats keep saying on the 2020 campaign trail.

recommendations.title: Not dead but gone: how a concussion changed my girlfriend's personality forever
recommendations.excerpt: It’s strange the way that, in a crisis, your mind stops filming and starts taking polaroids; essential snapshots of sound and color and light you can hold at arm’s length afterward.

recommendations.title: Five Things I Learned From the Mueller Report
recommendations.excerpt: I spent the week after the release of Special Counsel Robert Mueller’s report going through it section by section and writing a kind of diary of the endeavor.
